list.title: BaoFields
list.description: This module contains the built-in fields for Bao.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField
list.description: Base class for all fields. Do not instantiate this class directly.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#fromDy
list.description: Convert the field value from the DynamoDB representation to the JS representation.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#fromGsi
list.description: Convert the field value from the index format used by DynamoDB to the JS representation.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#getInitialValue
list.description: Get the initial JS value for the field.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#getUpdateExpression
list.description: Get the DynamoDB update expression for the field. You usually don't need to override this. By default, it will return a SET expression, unless the value is null. If the value is null, it will remove the attribute from the item .

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#toDy
list.description: Convert the field value from the JS representation to DynamoDB representation.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#toGsi
list.description: Convert the field value from the JS representation the index format used by DynamoDB. This must be a string representation of the value. Pay special attention to how this value sorts since it will be used for sort keys.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#updateBeforeSave
list.description: Update the field value before saving. An example of where you might override this is a modified date field that you want to update to the current date/time before saving.

list.title: BaoFields.BaoBaseField.BaoBaseField#validate
list.description: Validate the JS field value.

list.title: BaoFields.BinaryField
list.description: A field that stores a binary value.

list.title: BaoFields.BooleanField
list.description: A field that stores a boolean value.

list.title: BaoFields.CounterField
list.description: A field that stores an integer value that can be incremented or decremented atomically.

list.title: BaoFields.CreateDateField
list.description: A field that stores a date/time value based on when the object was created.

list.title: BaoFields.DateTimeField
list.description: A field that stores a date/time value.

list.title: BaoFields.FloatField
list.description: A field that stores a floating point number value.

list.title: BaoFields.IntegerField
list.description: A field that stores an integer value.

list.title: BaoFields.ModifiedDateField
list.description: A field that stores a date/time value based on when the object was last modified.

list.title: BaoFields.RelatedField
list.description: A field that points to another object in the database. This field makes it easy to load related objects.

list.title: BaoFields.StringField
list.description: A field that stores a string value.

list.title: BaoFields.StringSetField
list.description:
A field that stores a set of string values. Behind the scenes this is backed by a DynamoDB string set. This field cannot be indexed but can be used in filter expressions.

Supports direct mutation operations that automatically track changes:

  • add(value) - Add a string to the set
  • delete(value) - Remove a string from the set
  • clear() - Remove all strings from the set

list.title: BaoFields.TtlField
list.description: A field that stores a Unix timestamp in seconds that indicates when the object should be deleted. DynamoDB will automatically delete the item at the specified time. This field must be named "ttl" for DynamoDB to automatically delete the item.

list.title: BaoFields.UlidField
list.description: A field that stores a {@link https://github.com/ulid/spec ULID} value.

list.title: BaoFields.VersionField
list.description: A field that stores a ULID value that is used to track the version of the object. You can use this field to implement optimistic locking by using the version field as a condition in your update operation.

list.title: BaoModel
list.description: Base model that implements core functionality for all models. Do not instantiate this class directly, instead use a subclass, usually that has been generated by the code generator.

list.title: BaoModel#clearConsumedCapacity
list.description: Clear the consumed capacity for the current model instance.

list.title: BaoModel#clearRelatedCache
list.description: Clear the related cache for a given field.

list.title: BaoModel#exists
list.description: Returns true if the object exists. This is particularly useful when checking if an object has been found, since ObjectNotFound will be returned rather than null if an object is not found (so capacity information will also be returned).

list.title: BaoModel#getConsumedCapacity
list.description: Get the consumed capacity for the current model instance. Every entry in this array will represent a separate operation.

list.title: BaoModel#getNumericConsumedCapacity
list.description: Get the number of RCU/WCU consumed by a model instance. Additional capacity is added every time a new operation (finding, saving, loading related data) is performed on the instance. You can reset the consumed capacity by calling {@link BaoModel#clearConsumedCapacity}.

list.title: BaoModel#getOrLoadRelatedField
list.description: Get or load a related field. If the field is already loaded, it will be returned without reloading. Otherwise, it will be loaded from the database and returned.

list.title: BaoModel#getPrimaryId
list.description: Get the primary ID for a given object. This is a string that uniquely identifies the object in the database. When using {@link BaoModel.find}, this is the id to use. Do not make assumptions about how this id is formatted since it will depend on the model key structure.

list.title: BaoModel#getRelated
list.description: Get a related field. If the field is not loaded, it will return null.

list.title: BaoModel#hasChanges
list.description: Returns true if any fields have been modified since the object was last loaded from the database.

list.title: BaoModel#isLoaded
list.description: Returns true if the object has been loaded from the database.

list.title: BaoModel#loadRelatedData
list.description: Load objects for RelatedField's on the current model instance.

list.title: BaoModel#save
list.description: Save the current object to the database. This operation will diff the current state of the object with the state that has been loaded from dynamo to determine which changes need to be saved.

list.title: BaoModel.batchFind
list.description: This is the primary way to load multiple objects given an array of ids. This function should only be used when {@link BaoModel.find} or {@link BaoModel#loadRelatedData} is not sufficient.

list.title: BaoModel.create
list.description: Create a new item in the database.

list.title: BaoModel.delete
list.description: Delete an existing item in the database.

list.title: BaoModel.find
list.description: Find is the primary way to look up an object given its id. It will return the object if it exists, or an {@link ObjectNotFound} instance if it does not. Find supports efficient batch loading and caching. In general, this function should be preferred over {@link BaoModel.batchFind}. Find uses batchFind internally, unless batchDelay is set to 0.

list.title: BaoModel.findByUniqueConstraint
list.description: Find an object by a unique constraint. Any unique constraint can also be used to find an object.

list.title: BaoModel.getPrimaryId
list.description: Static version of {@link BaoModel#getPrimaryId}.

list.title: BaoModel.getRelatedObjectsViaMap
list.description:
Queries related objects via a mapping table.

This is primary used by the code generator to build helper functions for querying related objects. For most common operations, you should not need to use this method directly.

list.title: BaoModel.makePrimaryId
list.description: Make a primary ID from a pk and sk.

list.title: BaoModel.queryByIndex
list.description:
This is the primary method for querying data via a named index or primary key. If possible, you should always specify a sort key condition using skCondition. This will use dynamodb's index to query the data without scanning the partition.

Optionally, you can specify a filter condition to further narrow down the results. Please note that a filter condition will scan anything in the partition that matches the skCondition, so if you haven't specified a skCondition, this will scan the entire partition (and consume more capacity units). However, there may also be times when this works without issue and is more efficient than adding another index and paying for the write overhead of the index.

list.title: BaoModel.queryByPrimaryKey
list.description:
Queries items by their primary key value with an optional sort key condition

For more details, see queryByIndex. In general, it's recommended to use queryByIndex and give a name to the index. You can do this by adding an index name in the indexes section of the model definition and setting it to primaryKey. For example:

models: TaggedPost: ... indexes: postsForTag: this.primaryKey

list.title: BaoModel.setTestId
list.description: ONLY use this for testing. It allows tests to run in isolation and prevent data from being shared between tests/tests to run in parallel. However, it should not be used outside of this context. For examples, showing how to use this, see the tests.

list.title: BaoModel.update
list.description: Update an existing item in the database.

list.title: BatchLoadingMethods._executeFindDirect
list.description: Execute find operation directly without batching or caching

list.title: BatchLoadingMethods.isInsideBatchContext
list.description: Check if currently executing within a batch context

list.title: FilterExpressionBuilder
list.description: Do not instantiate this class directly. This is used by {@link BaoModel.queryByIndex}.

list.title: FilterExpressionBuilder#build
list.description: Build a filter expression for a given filter and model.

list.title: ObjectNotFound#exists
list.description: Returns false, since the object was not found.

list.title: ObjectNotFound#getNumericConsumedCapacity
list.description: Returns the numeric consumed capacity for the operation. For compatibility this method supports an includeRelated parameter, but it is ignored, since there are no related objects to consider.

list.title: TenantContext
list.description: Manages tenant context for multi-tenant applications using DynamoBao. Provides runtime tenant resolution and instance management with concurrency safety.

list.title: TenantContext.addResolver
list.description: Adds a resolver function to determine tenant context. Resolvers are tried in the order they were added.

list.title: TenantContext.clearResolvers
list.description: Clears all resolver functions.

list.title: TenantContext.clearTenant
list.description: Clears the current tenant context. For test cleanup and simple use cases.

list.title: TenantContext.getCurrentTenant
list.description: Gets the current tenant ID using async context or resolver chain. Concurrency-safe using AsyncLocalStorage.

list.title: TenantContext.getInstance
list.description: Gets or creates a ModelManager instance for the specified tenant.

list.title: TenantContext.reset
list.description: Resets all tenant context state (for testing).

list.title: TenantContext.runWithTenant
list.description: Runs a callback function with a specific tenant context. Ensures concurrency safety by using AsyncLocalStorage.

list.title: TenantContext.setCurrentTenant
list.description: Sets the current tenant ID and returns the associated ModelManager instance. For backward compatibility and simple use cases (like tests).

list.title: TenantContext.validateTenantRequired
list.description: Validates that tenant context is available when required by configuration.

list.title: TenantContext.withTenant
list.description: Explicit tenant override for cross-tenant operations. Alias for runWithTenant for better readability in cross-tenant scenarios.

list.title: _accumulateCapacityToContext
list.description: Accumulate capacity units to the current batch context. This is called internally by model operations to track total capacity consumed.

list.title: cleanupTestData
list.description: Legacy cleanup function for backward compatibility Now delegates to iteration-based cleanup

list.title: cleanupTestDataByIds
list.description: Fallback cleanup method for tracking individual items Only needed for non-iterable models (rare case)

list.title: cleanupTestDataByIteration
list.description: Clean up test data using iteration (recommended approach) All test models are now iterable, making this the primary cleanup method

list.title: generateTestTenant
list.description: Generate unique tenant ID for test isolation

list.title: getBatchContextCapacity
list.description: Get the total consumed capacity for the current batch context. Returns the accumulated RCUs and WCUs for all operations within the current runWithBatchContext scope.

list.title: initTestModelsWithTenant
list.description: Initializes models with tenant context for testing

list.title: runWithBatchContext
list.description: Initialize batch context for request-scoped batching. This should be called at the beginning of each request in Cloudflare Workers.

list.title: src/exceptions.js
list.description: Custom exception classes for dynamo-bao library. These provide more specific error types than generic Error objects.

list.title: trackCreatedItem
list.description: Helper function to track created items (for non-iterable models)

list.title: verifyCleanup
list.description: Verify cleanup was successful by checking if any items remain
